result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew W Helmick

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:52 PM 
Defendant Matthew W Helmick in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Matthew W Helmick.  Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty De La Rosa requests an additional status out 45 days.
--no objection from ADA Beck. 

recess: 2:55pm 
NEXT: Status on 12/1/22 at 3:00pm

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:57 PM 
Defendant Matthew W Helmick in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Matthew W Helmick.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance

Officer Stephen Riggs -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Witt 
--State's Exhibit #1: Victim/Witness Key (marked only for reference, not offered) The Court directs to be marked confidential. 
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa


The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Helmick committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 3:16pm  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/21/22 at 3:40pm (2) Status Conference on  10/6/22 at 2:30pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ml] Case called at 3:22PM
Defendant Matthew W Helmick in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (appearance is for purposes of scheduling). ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
Att De La Rosa advises that the Defendant qualifies for the Public Defender's services, and requests that a speedy Preliminary Hearing be scheduled.
At the request of Att De La Rosa, the Court advises that it will address bond modification at the next hearing.

recess 3:24PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 08/23 at 10:30AM (JA - note in comments - the Court will address the anticipated Defense Motion for Modification on Bond)
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 07-28-2022

1:17 PM.  Clerk - CRHI
Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew W Helmick appeared by video with Atty. De La Rosa by video, for bond only but evaluation is ongoing. 
By agreement of counsel, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
DOB and address on the Complaint verified. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge(*s) and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  Appointment process reviewed by the Court. 

Bail/bond recommendations presented by Counsel. 
Statement regarding bail/bond presented by the Guardian of named victim #1.

The Court requires a $5,000.00   CASH Bond, with conditions: 
--no unsupervised or direct contact with any person under the age of 18 years of age. 
--no contact with the victims/witnesses named in the Victim Witness Key.
--no presence at the residence of named victim/witness #2.  

The Court will toll Preliminary Hearing limits; presents basis. 

Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel 

Case continued for: 
Status (of Counsel) Conference on .8/15/22 at 3:15pm - In person; Br. 1
Recess 1:32pm

NEXT:   
Status (of Counsel) Conference on .8/15/22 at 3:15pm - In person; Br. 1
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key
